org.apache.freemarker.core.model

Interface TemplateDirectiveModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    TemplateCallableModel, TemplateModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IncludePage

    public interface TemplateDirectiveModel
extends TemplateCallableModel
    A TemplateCallableModel that progressively writes it result into the out object, instead of returning a single result at the end of the execution. Some directives won't print anything, and you call them from other side-effects, or do flow control (conditional execution or repetition of the nested content).

    They are not called from expression context, but on the top-level (that is, directly embedded into the static text). (If some future template language allows calling them from expression context, the printed output will be captured, and will be the return value of the call. Depending on the output format of the directive, the type of that value will be TemplateMarkupOutputModel or String.)

    Example usage in a template: <@my.menu style="foo" expand=true>...</@my.menu>, <@my.menuItem "Some title" icon="some.jpg" />.

    You can find utilities for implementing TemplateDirectiveModel-s in CallableUtils.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.freemarker.core.model.TemplateModel

        NOTHING

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(TemplateModel[] args,
             CallPlace callPlace,
             Writer out,
             Environment env)
      throws TemplateException,
             IOException
        Invokes the directive.
        Parameters:
        args - The array of argument values. Not null. If a parameter was omitted on the caller side, the corresponding array element will be null. The length of the array and the indexes correspond to the ArgumentArrayLayout returned by getDirectiveArgumentArrayLayout(). ArgumentArrayLayout os not nullm and the caller doesn't keep argument layout rules (such as the array is shorter than ArgumentArrayLayout.getTotalLength(), or the type of the values at ArgumentArrayLayout.getPositionalVarargsArgumentIndex() or at ArgumentArrayLayout.getNamedVarargsArgumentIndex() is improper), this method may throws IndexOutOfBoundsException or ClassCastException. Thus, user Java code that wishes to call TemplateCallableModel-s is responsible to ensure that the argument array follows the layout described be ArgumentArrayLayout, as the execute method isn't meant to do validations on that level.
        callPlace - The place (in a template, normally) where this directive was called from. Not null; in case the call is not from a template, you can use NonTemplateCallPlace.INSTANCE (or another NonTemplateCallPlace instance). Note that CallPlace.executeNestedContent(TemplateModel[], Writer, Environment) can be used to execute the nested content (even if there's no nested content; then simply nothing happens), and to pass nested content parameters to it.
        out - Print the output here (if there's any)
        env - The current processing environment. Not null in general, though certain implementations may specifically allow that, typically, implementations that are just adapters towards FreeMarker-unaware callables (for example, JavaMethodModel is like that).
        Throws:
        TemplateException - If any problem occurs that's not an IOException during writing the template output.
        IOException - When writing the template output fails.

      • isNestedContentSupported

        boolean isNestedContentSupported()
        Tells if this directive supports having nested content. If false, yet the caller specifies a non-empty nested content (non-0-length, even whitespace matters), FreeMarker will throw a TemplateException with descriptive error message, and execute(TemplateModel[], CallPlace, Writer, Environment) won't be called. If true, the author of the directive shouldn't forget calling CallPlace.executeNestedContent(TemplateModel[], Writer, Environment), unless the intent was to skip the nested content. (This property was added to prevent the frequent oversight (in FreeMarker 2) where a directive that isn't supposed to have nested content doesn't examine if there's a nested content to throw an exception in that case. Then if there's nested content, it will be silently skipped during execution, as the directive never calls CallPlace.executeNestedContent(TemplateModel[], Writer, Environment).)

      • getDirectiveArgumentArrayLayout

        ArgumentArrayLayout getDirectiveArgumentArrayLayout()
        Returns the argument array layout to use when calling the {@link #execute(TemplateModel[], CallPlace, Writer, Environment)} method, or rarely null. If it's null then there can only be positional arguments, any number of them (though of course the execute method implementation itself may restricts the acceptable argument count), and the argument array will be simply as long as the number of arguments specified at the call place.
